# NSPathControl

**Class**

A display of a file system path or virtual path information.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSPathControl
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] class uses [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathCell] to implement its user interface. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] provides cover methods for most [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathCell] methods—the cover method simply invokes the corresponding cell method. See also [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathComponentCell], which represents individual components of the path, and two associated protocols: [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathCellDelegate] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControlDelegate].

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] has three styles represented by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl/Style] enumeration constants [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl/Style/standard], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathStyle/NSPathStyleNavigationBar], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl/Style/popUp]. The represented path can be a file system path or any other type of path leading through a sequence of nodes or components, as defined by the programmer.

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] automatically supports drag and drop, which can be further customized via delegate methods. To accept drag and drop, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/registerForDraggedTypes(_:)] with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFilenamesPboardType] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSURLPboardType]. When the URL value in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl] object changes because of an automatic drag and drop operation or the user selecting a new path via the open panel, the action is sent. In OS X v10.5 the value returned by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl/clickedPathComponentCell()] is `nil`, in macOS 10.6 and later, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPathControl/clickedPathComponentCell()] returns the clicked cell.

## Setting the Control Style

- **pathStyle**: The receiver’s path style.

## Setting the Background Color

- **backgroundColor**: The receiver’s background color.

## Managing Path Components

- **clickedPathComponentCell()**: Returns the clicked cell.
- **pathComponentCells()**: Returns an array of the `NSPathComponentCell` objects currently being displayed.
- **setPathComponentCells(_:)**: Sets the array of `NSPathComponentCell` objects currently being displayed.

## Setting the Double-Click Action

- **doubleAction**: The receiver’s double-click action method.

## Setting the Path

- **url**: The path value displayed by the receiver.

## Setting the Delegate

- **delegate**: The receiver’s delegate.

## Setting the Drag Operation Mask

- **setDraggingSourceOperationMask(_:forLocal:)**: Configures the drag operation mask.

## Setting Popup Menu

- **menu**: The menu that is used for the path control’s cells.

## Instance Properties

- **allowedTypes**
- **clickedPathItem**
- **isEditable**
- **pathItems**
- **placeholderAttributedString**
- **placeholderString**

## Enumerations

- **NSPathControl.Style**: `NSPathStyle` constants represent the different visual and behavioral styles an `NSPathControl` or `NSPathCell` object can have.

## Inherits From

- NSControl
